Name: Azure AI Foundry Agent Service Documentation
Summary:
* Provides an overview and quickstart guides for Azure AI Foundry Agent Service, a managed platform for building, deploying, and scaling AI agents.  
* Offers detailed documentation on concepts, tools, features, and integrations related to the service.

Name: What is Foundry Agent Service?
Summary:
* Provides a platform that integrates models, tools, frameworks, and governance to build and operate intelligent agents.  
* Facilitates the deployment of secure, scalable, and production-ready AI agents for enterprise automation and workflow management.

Name: What's new
Summary:
* Provides updates on the general availability and new features of Azure AI Foundry Agent Service, including agent catalog, Visual Studio Code extension, connected and trace agents, and event-triggered agents.  
* Summarizes recent enhancements such as Azure monitor integration, BYO thread storage, Microsoft Fabric tool, and preview features like support for non-Azure OpenAI models and enterprise security.

Name: FAQ
Summary:
* Provides frequently asked questions and key information about the Azure AI Foundry Agent Service  
* Clarifies data storage, security, encryption, usage, regional presence, and pricing details

Name: Environment setup
Summary:
* Provides instructions for setting up the environment to create and manage agents using Azure AI Foundry Agent Service.  
* Outlines prerequisites, permissions, and configuration options for different setup modes (Basic, Standard, and Private Networking).

Name: Quickstart
Summary: Provides a step-by-step guide to creating, configuring, and running AI agents using Azure AI Foundry, including code samples, prerequisites, permissions, and API interactions

Name: Quotas and limits
Summary:
* Provides detailed quotas and limits for Azure AI Foundry Agent Service, including file sizes, number of files, and token limits.
* Guides on related Azure OpenAI model quotas and how to access additional resources and support.

Name: Model and region support
Summary:
* Provides an overview of supported models for Azure AI Foundry Agent Service, including Azure OpenAI models, non-Microsoft models, and models with or without tool-calling capabilities.
* Details deployment options, regional availability, and instructions for integrating various models into agent projects.

Name: Pricing
Summary:
* Indicates an error or invalid request to a system or service.  
* Likely a response message signaling that the request could not be processed due to client error.

Name: Threads, runs, and messages
Summary:
* Provides an overview of how Azure AI Foundry Agent Service manages conversation components including threads, runs, and messages.  
* Explains the creation, management, and interaction processes of agents, threads, messages, and runs within the service.

Name: Standard agent setup
Summary:
* Provides a detailed overview of the standard agent setup for Azure AI Foundry, emphasizing enterprise security, compliance, and control through customer-managed resources.  
* Outlines the provisioning process, resource requirements, data isolation, and role assignments necessary for a secure, scalable deployment.

Name: Tool Overview
Summary: Provides an overview of tools available in Azure AI Foundry Agent Service, including knowledge and action tools, their functionalities, and how they can be integrated to enhance AI agent capabilities.

Parent Path: Concepts > Tools > Grounding with Bing Search
Name: Overview
Summary:
* Provides instructions on integrating Grounding with Bing Search into Azure AI Agents to enable real-time web data retrieval for responses.
* Details setup, configuration, usage, and display requirements, including cost considerations and compliance notes.

Parent Path: Concepts > Tools > Grounding with Bing Search
Name: How to use Grounding with Bing Search
Summary:
* Provides step-by-step instructions and code samples for integrating Grounding with Bing Search into Azure AI Foundry agents.  
* Demonstrates how to create, configure, and use the Bing Grounding tool within different programming environments and via REST API.

Parent Path: Concepts > Tools > Use Grounding with Bing Custom Search
Name: Overview
Summary:
* Provides instructions on integrating and configuring Custom Bing Search with Azure AI Foundry Agents to enable domain-specific web searches.  
* Explains setup, configuration options, optional parameters, and considerations for utilizing Bing Custom Search within Azure AI solutions.

Parent Path: Concepts > Tools > Use Grounding with Bing Custom Search
Name: How to use Grounding with Bing Custom Search
Summary:
* Provides instructions for integrating and using the Grounding with Bing Custom Search tool within Azure AI Foundry Agent Service.  
* Outlines steps for creating connections, configuring agents, initiating threads, submitting user questions, and retrieving responses using REST API calls.

Name: Overview
Summary:
* Provides instructions on integrating and utilizing Azure AI Agents file search capabilities, including setup, file management, and search optimization.
* Explains how to create, manage, and cost-effectively use vector stores for searching and retrieving relevant document data within Azure AI Foundry.

Name: How to upload files
Summary:
* Provides step-by-step instructions and code samples for uploading files, creating vector stores, and integrating file search tools within Azure AI Foundry.  
* Demonstrates how to set up agents, attach files, run queries, and manage resources using both SDKs and REST API methods.

Name: Overview
Summary:
* Provides guidance on using an existing Azure AI Search index with the Azure AI Search tool within Azure AI Foundry.
* Details prerequisites, setup steps, and configuration options for integrating and connecting to the search index using SDKs and portal interfaces.

Name: How to use Azure AI Search
Summary:
* Provides step-by-step instructions for integrating and using Azure AI Search within Azure AI Foundry Agent Service.  
* Includes configuration, agent creation, querying, message handling, and resource cleanup procedures.

Name: Microsoft Fabric
Summary:
* Provides instructions on integrating Microsoft Fabric data agents with Azure AI Foundry Agent Service for enhanced data analysis and conversational Q&A capabilities.
* Outlines setup steps, prerequisites, API usage, and example code for creating agents, connections, and managing data queries securely.

Name: Logic apps
Summary:
* Provides a step-by-step guide to integrating Azure Logic Apps with Azure AI Foundry Agent Service for automating tasks like sending emails.
* Offers instructions on setting up Logic Apps, registering them with the AI project, creating agents with Logic App tools, and managing communication threads and runs.

Name: Function calling
Summary:
* Provides instructions and examples for using Azure AI Foundry Agent Service with function calling capabilities.  
* Demonstrates how to define, invoke, and manage functions within agent workflows across SDKs and REST API.

Name: Overview
Summary:
* Provides instructions on using Azure AI Foundry Agent Service with Code Interpreter to execute Python code for complex data analysis and problem-solving.  
* Details supported models, SDK options, file types, and key features, including cost considerations and session management.

Name: How to use code interpreter
Summary:
* Provides instructions and code samples for enabling and using the Code Interpreter tool within Azure AI Agents, including setup, file handling, and resource management.
* Offers detailed step-by-step guides for integrating the Code Interpreter with agents via portal, SDKs, and REST API, facilitating tasks like data analysis, visualization, and file manipulation.

Parent Path: Concepts > Tools > Use OpenAPI defined tools
Name: Overview
Summary:
* Provides guidance on connecting Azure AI Foundry Agent Service to external APIs using OpenAPI 3.0 specifications, enhancing interoperability and scalability.
* Details authentication methods (API key and managed identity), setup procedures, and security configurations to securely integrate and operate custom tools within Azure AI Foundry.

Parent Path: Concepts > Tools > Use OpenAPI defined tools
Name: How to use OpenAPI defined tools
Summary:
* Provides step-by-step instructions and code samples for using OpenAPI specifications with Azure AI Foundry tools and agents.  
* Demonstrates how to set up, configure, and utilize OpenAPI tools within Azure AI Foundry, including agent creation, message handling, run execution, and resource cleanup.

Parent Path: Concepts > Tools > Use OpenAPI defined tools
Name: Invoke an OpenAPI App Service web app
Summary:
* Provides guidance on connecting Azure AI Foundry Agent Service with an Azure App Service web app using the OpenAPI specification.  
* Details steps for deploying, configuring, and verifying integration to enable AI agents to invoke web app APIs for enhanced functionality.

Name: Overview
Summary:
* Provides guidance on integrating Azure Functions with Azure AI Foundry Agent Service to build scalable, event-driven AI applications.
* Details setup, deployment, and management of Azure Functions for function calling, including prerequisites, resource provisioning, and code deployment.

Name: How to use Azure Functions
Summary:
* Provides guidance on integrating Azure Functions with Azure AI Foundry Agents for processing function calls via queue messages.  
* Details setup, configuration, and deployment steps for creating Azure Functions, defining tools, creating agents, threads, and managing message flows within the Azure AI Foundry environment.

Name: Overview
Summary:
* Provides instructions on integrating Microsoft SharePoint with Azure AI Agent Service for secure document-based chat interactions.  
* Details setup, prerequisites, supported document types, and connection procedures for leveraging SharePoint data within AI agents.

Name: How to use SharePoint
Summary:
* Provides step-by-step instructions and code samples for using the SharePoint tool within Azure AI Foundry Agent Service.  
* Guides on creating agents, threads, adding user questions, running threads, and retrieving responses in the SharePoint integration.

Name: Use your own resources
Summary:
* Provides guidance on using Azure AI Foundry Agent Service with existing Azure resources such as AI Services, Azure OpenAI, Storage, Cosmos DB, and Search.  
* Details steps for configuring and deploying agents using your own resources in basic or standard setup modes.

Name: Connected agents
Summary:
* Provides guidance on building and managing multi-agent systems using Azure AI Foundry Connected Agents to streamline complex workflows without custom orchestration.

Name: Processes
Summary:

* Highlights key features, core concepts, and practical examples to facilitate the development and management of intelligent business processes

Name: Agent catalog
Summary:

* Lists available agent templates across various domains, with descriptions, authors, tools, and difficulty levels to facilitate tailored AI agent development.

Summary:

Name: Transparency note

* Outlines best practices for developing, deploying, and managing AI agents to ensure effective, secure, and ethical AI system implementation.

Name: Data, privacy, and security For Azure AI Foundry Agent Service
